intro: Libanothamnus neriifolius var. boconensis, commonly known as the Boconense Libanothamnus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, dark green leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with white or pale pink flowers, which bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
